qoute: A really great talent finds its happiness in execution.
A talent for drama is not a talent for writing, but is an ability to articulate human relationships.
Every man has his own vocation, talent is the call.
A best-seller is the golden touch of mediocre talent.
A bestseller is the gilded tomb of a mediocre talent.
A book is never a masterpiece: it becomes one. Genius is the talent of a dead man.
A great deal of talent is lost in the world for want of courage.
A talent somewhat above mediocrity, shrewd and not too sensitive, is more likely to rise in the world than genius.
Children's talent to endure stems from their ignorance of alternatives.
Coffee is good for talent, but genius wants prayer.
A really great talent finds its happiness in execution.
A talent for drama is not a talent for writing, but is an ability to articulate human relationships.
Every man has his own vocation, talent is the call.
A best-seller is the golden touch of mediocre talent.
A bestseller is the gilded tomb of a mediocre talent.
A book is never a masterpiece: it becomes one. Genius is the talent of a dead man.
A great deal of talent is lost in the world for want of courage.
A talent somewhat above mediocrity, shrewd and not too sensitive, is more likely to rise in the world than genius.
Children's talent to endure stems from their ignorance of alternatives.
Coffee is good for talent, but genius wants prayer.
Common sense is perhaps the most equally divided, but surely the most underemployed, talent in the world.
Concealed talent brings no reputation.
Dali is like a man who hesitates between talent and genius, or, as one might once have said, between vice and virtue.
Discipline is the refining fire by which talent becomes ability.
Doing easily what others find difficult is talent; doing what is impossible for talent is genius.
Everyone has a talent, what is rare is the courage to follow the talent to the dark place where it leads.
Everyone has talent. What is rare is the courage to follow the talent to the dark place where it leads.
For every talent that poverty has stimulated it has blighted a hundred.
Genius does what it must, and Talent does what it can.
Genius is the gold in the mine, talent is the miner who works and brings it out.
Genius is the gold in the mine; talent is the miner who works and brings it out.
Genius makes its observations in short-hand; talent writes them out at length.
Happiness is a how, not a what: a talent, not an object
Hard work without talent is a shame, but talent without hard work is a tragedy.
He had a wonderful talent for packing thought close, and rendering it portable.
Here is a field open for talent; and here, merit will a have certain favor, and industry is graced with its due reward.
I believe that every person is born with talent.
I have always had a talent for irritating women since I was fourteen.
I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.
I put all my genius into my life; I put only my talent into my works.
I'd rather have a lot of talent and a little experience than a lot of experience and a little talent.
I'd rather have a lot of talent and a little experience than a lot of experience and a little talent.
Ideas are a capital that bears interest only in the hands of talent.
If I have any talent at all it's from God, and my mom, who was on Capitol Records also.
If I have made any valuable discoveries, it has been owing more to patient attention than to any other talent.
If the cut of the costume indicates intellect and talent, then the color indicates temper and heart.
If you've got a talent, protect it.
Imagination is not a talent of some people but is the health of everyone.
Invention is the talent of youth, as judgment is of age.
It is a happy talent to know how to play.
It is personality with a penny's worth of talent. Error which chances to rise above the commonplace.
Let the path be open to talent.
Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself, but talent instantly recognizes genius.
Middle age snuffs out more talent than even wars or sudden death does.
Most successful men have not achieved their distinction by having some new talent or opportunity that was at hand.
My God given talent is my ability to stick with training longer than anybody else.
No one respects a talent that is concealed.
Stupidity is a talent for misconception.
Tact is one of the first mental virtues, the absence of it is fatal to the best talent.
Talent develops in quiet places, character in the full current of human life.
Talent develops in tranquillity, character in the full current of human life.
Talent does what it can; genius does what it must.
Talent is a faculty that is highly developed, but genius commands all the faculties.
Talent is a flame. Genius is a fire.
Talent is a matter of quantity. Talent does not write on page, it writes three hundred.
Talent is always conscious of its own abundance, and does not object to sharing.
Talent is nothing but a prolonged period of attention and a shortened period of mental assimilation.
Talent is only the starting point.
Talent works, genius creates.
The best friend is likely to acquire the best wife, because a good marriage is based on the talent for friendship.
The British have a remarkable talent for keeping calm, even when there is no crisis.
The cut of a garment speaks of intellect and talent and the color of temperament and heart.
The English instinctively admire any man who has no talent, and is modest about it.
The luck of having talent is not enough; one must also have a talent for luck.
The man who is born with a talent which he was meant to use finds his greatest happiness in using it.
The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.
The primary function of a theater is not to please itself, or even to please its audience. It is to serve talent.
The talent for being happy is appreciating and liking what you have, instead of what you don't have.
The talent of success is nothing more than doing what you can do well, and doing well whatever you do.
The world is always ready to receive talent with open arms. Very often it does not know what to do with genius.
The world is always ready to receive talent with open arms. Very often it does not know what to do with genius.
There is hardly a more common error than that of taking the man who has one talent, for a genius.
There is no substitute for talent. Industry and all the virtues are of no avail.
There is no such thing as talent. There is pressure.
This is how I define talent; it is a gift that God has given us in secret, which we reveal without knowing it.
Use what talent you possess: the woods would be very silent if no birds sang except those that sang best.
What mankind wants is not talent; it is purpose.
Why has God given me such magnificent talent? It is a curse as well as a great blessing.
With people of limited ability modesty is merely honesty. But with those who possess great talent it is hypocrisy.
Work while you have the light. You are responsible for the talent that has been entrusted to you.
Your talent is God's gift to you; what you do with it is your gift to God.
Youth itself is a talent - a perishable talent.
